name: Tutorial-Based Maze Project
description:
This is a learning opportunity! I am very new to Unreal Engine 4 but am having a lot of fun figuring things out. This will help track my progress maybe. I'm new to itch.io, too, but excited.

Credits and Acknowledgements (will add to the game in a future update)

Assets/Concept/Tutorials:

  • Ryan Laley (https://www.youtube.com/c/RyanLaley), sincere thanks for making easy-to-follow tutorials with each step and node explained.
  • "Halloween Pumpkins / 150+ variations" by Pack Dev

Music:

  • "Dark Walk" Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)
    Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 4.0 License
    http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/
  • "Lightless Dawn" Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)
    Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 4.0 License
    http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

This version is the most basic - what I packaged at the very end of the tutorial. So in theory, it will probably be like a lot of other projects that followed this same tutorial, apart from slight level design differences. I want a record of this, though, so I can compare future progress and changes made as I learn and explore the engine.

Please pardon Maze/Level 2! I got very lazy and want to have fun with it in the future :)
